result.execSummary:
The defendant Flentora D. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Flentora D. Adams

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Bond applied; partial refund.  gb/cp   ck# 15CH073889
From Atty J Campion about pre-sentence credit in the amount of 82 days.  So ordered on 3/6/15 by Judge Wagner.
Amended
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Campion.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Campion acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  Stipulation to be filed by ADA McNeill and Atty Campion concerning sentence credit.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Campion.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill requests to adjourn trial as the Detective witness is going to be out of town for training.  Court grants adjournment of trial to 3/2/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
Debbie G called, was subpeonaed but lives in MS and is in school, unable to appear for the JS on 1/20/15 at 9am, says she would be available by phone if needed.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John Campion.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Campion still waiting for some discovery from Joint Services.  Jury selection 1/20/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
State's notice of intent to use videotaped statements at trial - filed by ADA C McNeill.
With Shelley/Atty Campion the JSH of 12/18/14 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Campion is in trial; reset to 1/6/15 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Campion.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 12/18/14 at 1:15pm and JS 1/20/15 at 9am, pick & go.  Bond continued.
With ADA McNeill and Shelley/Atty Campion the FPT of 8/4/14 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Campion is unavailable; reset to 8/27/14 at 9am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Campion.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 8/4/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Campion.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Campion acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 6/2/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John Campion. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 4-2-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
